p.span: Frequently Asked Questions
Has the school year been canceled?
Answer:

Based on an executive order issued by Governor Ned Lamont, Waterbury Public Schools is closed through, at least, May 20. If the date is extended again, an update will be provided on the District website as well as on social media.
Has spring break been canceled
Answer:
Spring break (April 13-April 17) will fall during the extended closure.
Are meals available during the closure?
Answer:
Yes, breakfast and lunch continue to be available at 25
. Students, parents and families can pick up meals Monday through Friday from 9:00 a.m. to noon at any of the schools, even if that is not where the student is enrolled.
Where can my student or I access the online supplemental learning plan?
Answer:
The Academic Office has created a Distance Learning Plan for students to continue learning and engage with their teachers during this extended closure:
Additional online resources for all subjects can be found at the following link:
. It is updated on an almost daily basis. Supplemental learning materials for Pre-K through 12th grade are also available at
each of the 25 schools offering meal service Monday through Friday from 9:00 a.m. to noon.

A new packet with two weeks worth of assignments will be available on Monday, April 20. You can go to any one of the schools to pick up a packet. Please contact the Academic Office if you have any questions or concerns at
**Please note: Students should complete assignments online or complete the homework packet. They do not need to do both.**
Internet Access
: The Governor’s Office has compiled a comprehensive list of Internet providers offering various packages to help get Connecticut residents online and stay connected.
For a complete list of providers offering online access in various ways, click
Is the homework packet mandatory? Will students be graded on the assignments?
Answer:
The assignments will
not

be graded. They are meant to supplement learning for students who may have limited or no access to a computer or the Internet. We urge parents to ensure that students are setting aside a dedicated time to complete the assignments daily.
What will be the implication for seniors
if school is closed for the remainder of the academic year? Will graduations be canceled?
Answer:

Promotion status has not been determined for students at any grade level and students in all grades are highly encouraged to continue work on online materials or the supplemental learning material made available at 25 schools. Graduation ceremonies have not been canceled at this time. If that changes, based on guidance from the Governor and state officials, we will relay that information quickly. The District’s foremost priority is the well-being and health of our students and staff.
I am having difficulty logging into some of the online learning platforms. Who should I contact?
Answer:

The District is working every day to ensure all sites are working properly. We appreciate your patience during this challenging time. If you have trouble logging in to any of the online resources, please email
with specific questions or concerns.
Is the District considering using a platform such as Google Classroom to continue instruction?
Answer:
The Distance Learning Plan can be accessed

. We understand that not all of our students have access to a computer and/or Internet at home. We assure you that students who are not able to participate online right away or at all will not be penalized.
Is supplemental learning being provided for Adult Education?
Answer:
At this time, supplemental learning for Adult Education is not available, however, the Academic Office is working on creating a list of resources.
How will the third marking period end?
Answer:
At this juncture, schools are closed until at least May 20. Beyond that, everything is on hold until further notice.
With schools still closed, how can my child still obtain working papers?
Answer:

All minors are still required to have working papers. It is illegal for a business to have a minor working on the premises without proper documentation of age. In order to abide by the practice of social distancing, students or parents are requested to call (203) 574-8000, 8001 or 8004 during the school closure. A member of the Superintendent’s staff will assist you in faxing or emailing the papers or setting up an in-person appointment.
